results.title: Chocolate
results.brief_description: Shows people, including Woody Allen, Jonathon Winters and Jo Ann Worley, tasting a cocoa bean and trying to guess what it was. The film depicts, without narration, the manufacture of chcolate from the extraction of the nuts from the cocoa buds to the addition of sugar to the chocolate powder.

results.title: Chocolat [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Miramax Films, David Brown Productions, David Brown, Kit Golden, Leslie Holleran and Lasse Hallstrom
results.brief_description: Set in rural France, 1959, “Chocolat” is a comic look at traditional mores of a community dominated by the presence of the Catholic Church, revolutionised by the presence of a free-spirited woman with radical ideas about freedom of choice and sensuality. Vianne and her young daughter arrive in Lansquenet, a town where people live austerely, and miserably, whilst disguising their many sins and foibles. Vianne opens a chocolatiers in the main square, just prior to Lent, which causes a scandal among the locals, who slander Vianne, despite being intrigued by her delicious concoctions. But more than just tasty morsels, Vianne’s food is tonic for woes whether it is ennui, grumpiness or impotence. The drama of the Mayor’s intentions to run Vianne out of town is complicated by the presence of Roux (Johnny Depp) a gypsy who is shunned, (along with his brood), by the townsfolk and forms a romantic attachment with Vianne. The film, peppered with stars, is quite saccharine in tone and, at times, cloying with its good intentions. But despite these quibbles, “Chocolat” is distinctly and effectively feel-good and is glorious to look at even as it mythologises an unrecognisable France of the 1950s. Hallstrom (Cider house rules, My life as a dog, The Shipping news) produces his most digestible, albeit unchallenging work to date.

results.title: Chocolat [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Oceania Produzioni Internazionali Cinematografiche, Cerito Films, La Sept, Alain Belmondo, Gerald Crosnier and Claire Denis
results.brief_description: Memories of a childhood in a remote part of the French Cameroons provides the basis for this subtle, partly autobiographical, portrait of a colonial society. France (a surrogate for the filmmaker), revisiting the Cameroons, flashes back to scenes of her youth when her father was a French colonial official. The precarious equilibrium of their household (the mother is attracted to a young black servant) is disturbed by the sudden arrival of a group of outsiders, both European and African, after the forced landing of their plane nearby. The sharpness of the observation and the performances - each of the outsiders represents a different perspective on Africa - prevents the film from sliding into easy nostalgia for a time and way of life long since past. Cast: Isaach de Bankole, Giulia Boschi, Francois Cluzet, Jean-Claude Adelin. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Chocky
results.creator_credit: Thorn EMI, Vic Hughes and Christopher Hodson
results.brief_description: Matthew Gore’s life is just like any other 12 year olds, until he meets ‘Chocky’. What makes Chocky different from Matthew’s other friends is that she cannot be seen, speaks inside Matthew’s head and is an explorer from another world. Matthew develops new physical and mental capabilities through Chocky’s guidance, however it also isolates him from family and friends and eventually throws him into the media spotlight. Matthew is forced to make some adult decisions about his unique friend and their relationship. Based on the novel by renowned science fiction writer John Wyndham.

results.title: Chitty Chitty Bang Bang (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Warfield Productions, Dramatic Features, Albert R. Broccoli, Ken Hughes and Ken Adam
results.brief_description: The author of James Bond, Ian Fleming, wrote this charming story of a car that could fly. This is a wonderful musical/comedy fantasy for the whole family starring Dick Van Dyke and Gert Frobe. It is recreated for the screen by the director Ken Hughes of “Those Magnificent Men in Their Flying Machines”.

results.title: Chisels
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic woodwork”.
Demonstrates the various uses to which chisels can be put and includes description of method of choosing the right tool for the job.

results.title: Chip Carving
results.brief_description: Chip carving is a wonderfully direct and simple way to decorate furniture, cabinets, boxes and plaques. Discusses the basics: how to approach design, sharpen the knife, hold a consistent angle and use it to carve four different borders, a rosette and a free form.
